column1: So he said good-bye to his family
column2: and drove away.When he had travelled half-way
column3: he met a merchant whom he knew
column4: and they put up at the same inn for the night. They had some tea together
column5: and then went to bed in adjoining rooms.It was not Aksionov's habit to sleep late
column7: wishing to travel while it was still cool
column8: he aroused his driver before dawn
column9: and told him to put in the horses.Then he made his way across to the landlord of the inn (who lived in a cottage at the back)
column11: and continued his journey.When he had gone about twenty-five miles
column12: he stopped for the horses to be fed. Aksionov rested awhile in the passage of the inn
column13: then he stepped out into the porch
column15: ordering a samovar to be heated
column16: got out his guitar and began to play.
